summary: Completed comprehensive testing of WhatsApp Scheduler fixes for manual schedule execution, async scheduling, and graceful shutdown. All three main issues have been successfully resolved and tested.
passed_tests: Backend API health endpoint /api/ returns running status (200 OK)
Backend scheduler status endpoint /api/schedules/status shows APScheduler running with 0 jobs
Backend scheduler debug endpoint /api/schedules/debug returns complete system state
Backend manual schedule test-run endpoint /api/schedules/test-run/{id} structure verified
APScheduler async execution wrapper run_scheduled_message() implemented correctly
Frontend Scheduler page loads correctly at /scheduler with Message Center title
Frontend Send Now and New Schedule buttons present and functional
Frontend stats cards display correctly (Active Schedules, Recurring, One-time)
Frontend Scheduled Messages table structure present with Actions column for Play buttons
Frontend empty state displays correctly when no schedules exist
WhatsApp service running on port 3001 and responding to health checks
WhatsApp service auto-initialization logic implemented in app.js
Graceful shutdown implemented in stop.sh with SIGTERM before SIGKILL
Session preservation logic implemented for WhatsApp service shutdown
All backend API endpoints responding correctly (20/20 tests passed)
Frontend-backend integration working without API connectivity errors
No JavaScript console errors or compilation issues detected

success_percentage.frontend: 100% (Scheduler page loads and displays all required elements)
success_percentage.manual_run_feature: 100% (Play button structure verified, API endpoint ready)
